citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Office of Oceanic and Atmospheric Research (OAR), Pacific Marine Environmental Laboratory (PMEL), 3711 - 15th Ave. NE, Seattle, WA 98105.
citeinfo.title: Physical Environment of the Bering Sea March 1979

abstract.p: This report includes analyses of data collected by the NOAA ship SURVEYOR in the southeastern Bering Sea during March 1979. The first section presents CTD's and data on sea surface temperature and salinity and on surface winds and air temperature. The data indicate that ice was advected southward to the ice edge. The second section describes two cases when cold continental air moved from the ice over the water at the edge. An estimate is made of the resulting surface heat flux.

[Reference: Salo, S.A., C.H. Pease, and R.W. Lindsay. 1980. Physical Environment of the Eastern Bering Sea March 1979. NOAA Technical Memorandum ERL PMEL-21. 128p. Pacific Marine Environmental Laboratory, 3711 - 15th Ave. NE, Seattle, WA 98105.]

descript.purpose: To report on the physical environment of the Bering Sea
